speaker: Tutorial Wizard
text: Chapter Fourteen: Precision Sliders. These three controls in the header bar apply to every engine — Custom, Design, and Clone. Mastering them is the difference between adequate results and professional-quality audio.

speaker: Tutorial Wizard
text: Temperature controls creativity and energy. Think of it as the voltage running through the performance. A low temperature — below point five — produces a highly stable, neutral, almost robotic delivery. This is ideal for long narration, legal disclaimers, or fixing a voice clone that sounds 'drunk' or slurred.

speaker: Tutorial Wizard
text: The sweet spot for most voices is between point six and point nine. This produces natural-sounding speech with good expressiveness. The tutorials you are listening to now were generated in this range.

speaker: Tutorial Wizard
text: A high temperature — above one point zero — unleashes dramatic, highly emotional performances. Use it for shouting, crying, or intense character acting. But be aware: high temperature combined with contradictory style instructions significantly increases the chance of glitches and audio artifacts.

speaker: Tutorial Wizard
text: Top P controls the vocabulary range — how many possible sounds the model considers at each step. A low value, below point five, produces focused, crisp, clear pronunciation. A high value, near one point zero, produces more diverse intonation and natural character in the rhythm.

speaker: Tutorial Wizard
text: The Seed field is the third control, and it is the most powerful for reproducibility. Type any integer into the Seed field and every generation using that seed will produce byte-for-byte identical audio, regardless of when or how many times you run it. This is essential for controlled A B comparisons.

speaker: Tutorial Wizard
text: Leave the Seed field empty and the app automatically picks a random seed at generation time, then writes it back into the field. This means you always have the seed of your last take available, even when you did not plan ahead.

speaker: Tutorial Wizard
text: Click the Dice button next to the Seed field to roll a new random number into the field without generating. This is useful when you want to pre-set a seed before a long batch run, so that every block gets a known starting seed.

speaker: Tutorial Wizard
text: Please load Chapter Fifteen: Pro Tips for Tags and Punctuation, for the final layer of in-script performance control.
